video.title: House, M.D.
video.synopsis: Hugh Laurie stars as the ornery Dr. Gregory House, a paradoxical physician who loathes his patients but is a genius at treating mysterious ailments.

episodes.synopsis: Dr. Gregory House and his elite team rush to save the life of a teacher after she starts to speak gibberish and passes out in front of her class.
episodes.title: Pilot

episodes.synopsis: When a teenage lacrosse player comes down with an unidentifiable brain disease, House and the team hustle to give his parents answers.
episodes.title: Paternity

episodes.synopsis: When a college student collapses after a round of raucous sex with his girlfriend, Dr. House and his team scramble to figure out why.
episodes.title: Occam's Razor

episodes.synopsis: When an epidemic of sick babies strikes the maternity ward, House spars with Cameron over his plan to sacrifice one baby for the good of the rest.
episodes.title: Maternity

episodes.synopsis: A nun who visits the clinic with swollen arms, a rash and bleeding in her palms causes the team to deal with questions about their own lives.
episodes.title: Damned If You Do

episodes.synopsis: Suspecting that a schizophrenic woman with life-threatening blood clots is lying about her drinking, House dispatches his team to investigate.
episodes.title: The Socratic Method

episodes.synopsis: To save a young woman who falls ill to a disease she can't possibly have, the team must acknowledge that House is right: Everybody lies.
episodes.title: Fidelity

episodes.synopsis: When a student falls victim to a mysterious poisoning, House sends Cameron to the teen's home to find the hot new drug House is sure he's taking.
episodes.title: Poison

episodes.synopsis: After he ignores the "do not resuscitate" wishes of a legendary jazz musician who thinks he's dying from ALS, House finds himself facing a lawsuit.
episodes.title: DNR

episodes.synopsis: Foreman believes a homeless woman is faking seizures to get free meals at the hospital, but Wilson vows to keep her from falling between the cracks.
episodes.title: Histories

episodes.synopsis: While trying to figure out why a patient won't stop bleeding, House takes Cuddy's challenge and goes off Vicodin, but with dangerous results.
episodes.title: Detox

episodes.synopsis: When a severely broken arm reveals a bizarre case of bone loss in a major league pitcher, House suspects the athlete may be abusing steroids.
episodes.title: Sports Medicine

episodes.synopsis: A major donor to the hospital makes escalating demands of the team as they try to diagnose his 12-year-old son's pneumonia-like symptoms.
episodes.title: Cursed

episodes.synopsis: Princeton-Plainsboro Teaching Hospital is turned upside down when a billionaire entrepreneur buys his way into becoming Chairman of the Board.
episodes.title: Control

episodes.synopsis: When a mobster collapses just before he's scheduled to testify, a court orders House to discover if the crook's condition is real or an act.
episodes.title: Mob Rules

episodes.synopsis: When an obese 10-year-old girl suffers a heart attack, House and his team suspect an adverse reaction to diet pills -- or worse.
episodes.title: Heavy

episodes.synopsis: When a promising young senator becomes violently ill, clues point to AIDS -- a condition that would destroy his presidential ambitions for good.
episodes.title: Role Model

episodes.synopsis: A pregnant woman suffering brain and kidney dysfunction might have to make a heartbreaking choice between her life and the life of her unborn child.
episodes.title: Babies and Bathwater

episodes.synopsis: While a meningitis scare overwhelms the hospital, House focuses on a 12-year-old girl whose symptoms may only be mimicking meningitis.
episodes.title: Kids

episodes.synopsis: While the hospital is rife with speculation about House's imminent date with Cameron, House apparently scares a meek patient into having a stroke.
episodes.title: Love Hurts

episodes.synopsis: House's ex-girlfriend asks him to help her ailing husband. Meanwhile, Cuddy instructs House to present a lecture to a class of medical students.
episodes.title: Three Stories

episodes.synopsis: House insists he can handle the case of his ex-girlfriend's new husband, but the medical puzzle may prove to be one that even House can't solve.
episodes.title: Honeymoon

episodes.synopsis: When a death row inmate mysteriously and suddenly collapses after hallucinating, House jumps at the chance to take the case.
episodes.title: Acceptance

episodes.synopsis: House suspects that the remarkable courage a 9-year-old terminal cancer patient displays may actually be a symptom of her disease.
episodes.title: Autopsy

episodes.synopsis: When her handyman falls from her roof and develops strangely darkened pinkies, Cuddy joins the team to figure out what's wrong with him.
episodes.title: Humpty Dumpty

episodes.synopsis: A doctor renowned for fighting tuberculosis in Africa is admitted with TB-like symptoms, but House thinks he has a different condition.
episodes.title: TB or Not TB

episodes.synopsis: A recent college grad collapses at a party, but the team's efforts to treat him are hampered by the man's dysfunctional relationship with his father.
episodes.title: Daddy's Boy

episodes.synopsis: A famous cyclist is brought in after collapsing during a race, but House refuses to treat him because he suspects the man is lying about his drug use.
episodes.title: Spin

episodes.synopsis: House lands in hot water when a man with full-blown AIDS confronts him, collapses, then claims that House assaulted him.
episodes.title: Hunting

episodes.synopsis: House and Chase face possible disciplinary action for their role in the unexpected death of a mother of two young girls.
episodes.title: The Mistake

episodes.synopsis: The team thinks an off-track betting gambler suffering from various complaints is faking her illnesses for attention, but House disagrees.
episodes.title: Deception

episodes.synopsis: With House out of town, the team is on its own to diagnose the condition afflicting a journalist who is suddenly unable to form coherent sentences.
episodes.title: Failure to Communicate

episodes.synopsis: A young wife on fertility medication is brought to Princeton-Plainsboro when her inexplicable muscle flailing causes her to crash her car.
episodes.title: Need to Know

episodes.synopsis: When a young man comes into the hospital severely burned, House and his team must improvise new methods for testing his blood.
episodes.title: Distractions

episodes.synopsis: House treats a teenage supermodel for heroin addiction and, in the process, uncovers a startling secret about the girl.
episodes.title: Skin Deep

episodes.synopsis: Treating a man who needs an urgent heart transplant, House finds a suitable organ donor -- if he can diagnose the donor's mysterious illness in time.
episodes.title: Sex Kills

episodes.synopsis: House and his team take on a new patient seeking treatment after he suffers a respiratory attack brought on during sexual role-playing.
episodes.title: Clueless

episodes.synopsis: House investigates when a girl with a weakened immune system has a severe allergic reaction and goes into shock despite living in a "clean" room.
episodes.title: Safe

episodes.synopsis: A fundraising poker tournament at the hospital is interrupted when a boy is admitted exhibiting symptoms that remind House of a former patient.
episodes.title: All In

episodes.synopsis: The team treats a young woman who, after not being able to sleep for more than a week, downs an entire bottle of sleeping pills.
episodes.title: Sleeping Dogs Lie

episodes.synopsis: House thinks a 15-year-old self-proclaimed faith healer is a clever con -- until the boy causes a patient's cancer to go into remission.
episodes.title: House vs. God

episodes.synopsis: In Part 1 of 2, a police officer is admitted in critical condition with a gunshot wound to the head and symptoms that include unexplained giddiness.
episodes.title: Euphoria: Part 1

episodes.synopsis: In Part 2 of 2, Foreman experiences the same dire progression of symptoms as the dead policeman: blindness, muscle contractures and excruciating pain.
episodes.title: Euphoria: Part 2

episodes.synopsis: When a mother's seizure causes the near-drowning of her newborn son, House and the team race to diagnose her and resuscitate the infant boy.
episodes.title: Forever

episodes.synopsis: A girl having hallucinations about Hurricane Katrina is brought to House by her father, House's ex-bandmate, who just discovered his paternity.
episodes.title: Who's Your Daddy?

episodes.synopsis: As House and his team work on diagnosing a man with a giant swollen tongue, a disgruntled former patient walks into House's office and shoots him.
episodes.title: No Reason

episodes.synopsis: After recovering from his gunshot wounds, House takes on two cases simultaneously, one of which he pushes to the edge of accepted medical practices.
episodes.title: Meaning

episodes.synopsis: House fights to save a young boy who claims he's being experimented on by aliens, and Cuddy and Wilson withhold the truth about House's last case.
episodes.title: Cane and Able

episodes.synopsis: House and his team are pulled in differing ethical directions when one of their patients asks them to help him end his life.
episodes.title: Informed Consent

episodes.synopsis: House tries to decipher a 10-year-old severely autistic boy's signals in order to diagnose what is causing him to scream.
episodes.title: Lines in the Sand

episodes.synopsis: House and his team race to save a young couple suffering similar illnesses, but they have to look beyond the bonds of marriage to discover the answer.
episodes.title: Fools for Love

episodes.synopsis: A 600-pound man is admitted to the hospital after he is found in his apartment in a coma, but his weight may not be the real culprit.
episodes.title: Que Sera Sera

episodes.synopsis: House awakens a man who's been in a coma for ten years in order to glean some family history that could save his son's life.
episodes.title: Son of a Coma Guy

episodes.synopsis: A young man forced to take on the role of father to his siblings is faced with a choice that could potentially save his life or break up his family.
episodes.title: Whac-A-Mole

episodes.synopsis: House takes a patient's parents to court in order to get his course of treatment enforced, and Tritter pressures Foreman to reveal House's drug use.
episodes.title: Finding Judas

episodes.synopsis: Furious that Wilson has struck a deal with Tritter, House takes on the case of a young dwarf with an unexplained illness that's killing her.
episodes.title: Merry Little Christmas

episodes.synopsis: House makes a last-ditch effort to avoid jail time, and the team treats a firefighter with a secret he's willing to risk his life to keep.
episodes.title: Words and Deeds

episodes.synopsis: While on compulsory clinic duty, House encounters a rape victim who challenges him to unravel a very different kind of medical puzzle.
episodes.title: One Day, One Room

episodes.synopsis: House tries to get his handicapped parking spot back, and he and the team try to help a gypsy whose family refuses all modern medical treatments.
episodes.title: Needle in a Haystack

episodes.synopsis: House takes on the case of a young woman who can't feel any pain, but whose condition after a car accident takes an unexpected turn for the worse.
episodes.title: Insensitive

episodes.synopsis: House encounters a brain-damaged musical prodigy with inexplicable abilities, and the team faces serious concerns about House's own health.
episodes.title: Half-Wit

episodes.synopsis: While House deals with his own ailment, the team examines an ex-Marine who's been suffering from mysterious symptoms since returning home from duty.
episodes.title: Top Secret

episodes.synopsis: When a celebrity photographer's unborn child endangers her health, the team must take action before it's too late to save either of them.
episodes.title: Fetal Position

episodes.synopsis: House and Cuddy board a flight home from Singapore, but a violent illness begins spreading among the passengers, putting their own lives in danger.
episodes.title: Airborne

episodes.synopsis: When a 6-year-old girl collapses with ailments expected in much older patients, House sends Chase and Cameron to investigate her home life.
episodes.title: Act Your Age

episodes.synopsis: The team takes on the case of a young female scam artist who passes out while working a card-playing scheme on the streets.
episodes.title: House Training

episodes.synopsis: House and his team go to extreme measures to diagnose a young boy so he can in turn save his dying older brother's life.
episodes.title: Family

episodes.synopsis: Foreman hands in his resignation, and the team races to diagnose a young college student who coughs up a mouthful of blood during karate class.
episodes.title: Resignation

episodes.synopsis: An obnoxious teen chess prodigy comes in to be treated for intense headaches that began after he attacked an opponent in a chess tournament.
episodes.title: The Jerk

episodes.synopsis: A couple endures peril on the open seas in an effort to reach America and have House personally diagnose the wife's affliction.
episodes.title: Human Error

episodes.synopsis: When an office building collapses, House works fast to diagnose a young woman who survived the disaster but can now only communicate by blinking.
episodes.title: Alone

episodes.synopsis: To reconstitute his empty staff, House brings in 40 applicants and pits them against each other in a do-or-die Darwinian trial period.
episodes.title: The Right Stuff

episodes.synopsis: The final fellowship candidates compete ferociously when House splits them into two teams to treat a wheelchair-bound man who is slowly suffocating.
episodes.title: 97 Seconds

episodes.synopsis: When a funeral home cosmetician hallucinates that the cadavers have come to life, House and the remaining fellowship candidates investigate.
episodes.title: Guardian Angels

episodes.synopsis: While the final six fellowship candidates treat a man who might be a hypochondriac, they discover more about themselves than their patient.
episodes.title: Mirror Mirror

episodes.synopsis: The CIA recruits House to diagnose an agent with a mysterious lethal illness but refuses to reveal the agent's history or previous assignments.
episodes.title: Whatever It Takes

episodes.synopsis: After a teen being filmed for a documentary suffers a heart attack, the cameras turn their focus to the work of House and the fellowship candidates.
episodes.title: Ugly

episodes.synopsis: After a magician's heart stops during an underwater escape act, House sets out to prove the illusionist is a scam artist faking his ailments.
episodes.title: You Don't Want to Know

episodes.synopsis: House tells the candidates to diagnose an uncooperative, over-the-hill former punk rock star with a history of drug abuse and civil disobedience.
episodes.title: Games

episodes.synopsis: When House and the team treat a woman who suffers from a sudden paralysis of the hands, they suspect she is withholding vital information.
episodes.title: It's a Wonderful Lie

episodes.synopsis: When the sole medical officer stationed at the South Pole becomes ill, Hill and the team work via Webcam to help the doctor diagnose herself.
episodes.title: Frozen

episodes.synopsis: When a formerly hard-living music producer collapses, House and his team must diagnose her without upsetting her newfound religious beliefs.
episodes.title: Don't Ever Change

episodes.synopsis: House suspects that an ER patient has a bigger problem than his original diagnosis based on the fact that the man is just too darn nice.
episodes.title: No More Mr. Nice Guy

episodes.synopsis: House intervenes when he concludes that one of the actors on his favorite soap opera, "Prescription Passion," has a serious medical condition.
episodes.title: Living the Dream

episodes.synopsis: In Part 1, House barely survives a terrible bus crash, but his sketchy memories convince him he had seen a fellow passenger exhibiting strange signs.
episodes.title: House's Head

episodes.synopsis: In Part 2, House tries to access his pre-bus-accident memories to find the information he needs to save a fellow crash victim.
episodes.title: Wilson's Heart

episodes.synopsis: Still reeling from the death of his girlfriend, Wilson resigns from Princeton-Plainsboro and ponders whether to sever his friendship with House.
episodes.title: Dying Changes Everything

episodes.synopsis: When several people suddenly die five years after receiving transplants from a single organ donor, House rushes to save the two surviving recipients.
episodes.title: Not Cancer

episodes.synopsis: House and the team work with a struggling artist whose undiagnosed illness is distorting his perception and undermining his work.
episodes.title: Adverse Events

episodes.synopsis: While traveling, House works with his team via cell phone to diagnose the case of a woman who collapses during a visit to China.
episodes.title: Birthmarks

episodes.synopsis: When a woman with whom Thirteen had a one-night stand has a seizure, the team takes on the case, exposing Thirteen's hard-partying lifestyle.
episodes.title: Lucky Thirteen

episodes.synopsis: The team takes on the case of a dreary middle-aged man who has been experiencing unexplained, recurring blackouts and time lapses.
episodes.title: Joy

episodes.synopsis: When an agoraphobic man falls mysteriously ill but refuses to leave his home, House and the team must find a way to bring the hospital to him.
episodes.title: The Itch

episodes.synopsis: The team takes on the case of an underage factory manager living on her own who falls ill when her lungs suddenly fill with fluid.
episodes.title: Emancipation

episodes.synopsis: A gun-wielding man claiming to have a long-undiagnosed illness takes hostages at the hospital in order to get a diagnosis from House.
episodes.title: Last Resort

episodes.synopsis: House and the team take on the case of a high-profile, all-natural fitness guru who collapses while shooting an infomercial.
episodes.title: Let Them Eat Cake

episodes.synopsis: House and the team encounter a teenager long troubled by bullies, who collapses during her high school Christmas program.
episodes.title: Joy to the World

episodes.synopsis: At Cameron's urging, House and the team take on the case of a man living with such severe chronic pain that he tries to kill himself.
episodes.title: Painless

episodes.synopsis: Now supervising House, Cameron struggles to maintain her authority when the team takes the case of a teacher who spit up blood during class.
episodes.title: Big Baby

episodes.synopsis: Things get personal for House and the team when they diagnose a renowned cancer researcher who had given up her career to pursue a simpler life.
episodes.title: The Greater Good

episodes.synopsis: When a troubled priest sees a bleeding Jesus hovering at his doorstep, House takes the case -- and grapples with his own past and beliefs.
episodes.title: Unfaithful

episodes.synopsis: After they take the case of a teenager who collapses from pelvic pain while playing basketball, the team gets a surprise about the kid's gender.
episodes.title: The Softer Side

episodes.synopsis: The team takes on the case of a book editor who loses his inhibition and begins to vocalize all his innermost thoughts in sudden, insulting outbursts.
episodes.title: The Social Contract

episodes.synopsis: House and the team take on the curious case of a woman who falls drastically ill after claiming that her pet cat had predicted her imminent demise.
episodes.title: Here Kitty

episodes.synopsis: House realizes that an accident victim written off as brain dead is actually fully conscious but unable to communicate -- except by blinking.
episodes.title: Locked In

episodes.synopsis: When an aging woman who takes care of her ailing husband winds up in the hospital with him, she makes an extraordinary request of House and his team.
episodes.title: Simple Explanation

episodes.synopsis: Cameron pressures House to diagnose an environmental activist who collapses at a rally, but House makes Cameron take the lead in the case.
episodes.title: Saviors

episodes.synopsis: The team takes on the case of a deaf 14-year-old who collapses after he starts "hearing" explosions while competing in a wrestling match.
episodes.title: House Divided

episodes.synopsis: House and the team work to diagnose a ballerina whose lungs collapse in the middle of a performance, but their treatment causes her skin to fall off.
episodes.title: Under My Skin

episodes.synopsis: The team struggles to work with a patient whose left brain and right brain operate independently, leaving him with two distinct personalities.
episodes.title: Both Sides Now

episodes.synopsis: House begins a detox program at Mayfield Psychiatric Hospital to get the vicodin out of his system in an attempt to control his hallucinations.
episodes.title: Broken: Part 1

episodes.synopsis: After the delusional patient jumps off of a building, House decides that he needs to face himself and accept treatment from Dr. Nolan.
episodes.title: Broken: Part 2

episodes.synopsis: House returns and has surprising news for Cuddy. An ailing video game creator opts for treatments suggested by people on the Internet.
episodes.title: Epic Fail

episodes.synopsis: The team treats a controversial African politician named Dibala who has fallen ill while coming to America to give a speech at the United Nations.
episodes.title: The Tyrant

episodes.synopsis: A wealthy businessman insists on having Dr. House handle the case of his teenage son, who is suffering from inexplicable stomach pains.
episodes.title: Instant Karma

episodes.synopsis: Cameron pushes the team to treat a man whose father, grandfather and great-grandfather have all died of a sudden heart attack before the age of 40.
episodes.title: Brave Heart

episodes.synopsis: After a wild night out, a teenage girl is brought in with severely swollen appendages. The team must work to diagnose the uncooperative young girl.
episodes.title: Known Unknowns

episodes.synopsis: After House's medical license is reinstated, he reclaims his role as Head of Diagnostics in time to treat an adult film star admitted for eye pain.
episodes.title: Teamwork

episodes.synopsis: On the eve of Thanksgiving, House and the team take on the case of a brilliant physicist and author who traded his career for a job as a courier.
episodes.title: Ignorance Is Bliss

episodes.synopsis: An old friend and former patient of Wilson's experiences paralysis in his left arm. Wilson takes this case himself.
episodes.title: Wilson

episodes.synopsis: A man who associates with drug dealers collapses during a sale, but won't reveal personal information to the team because it might incriminate him.
episodes.title: The Down Low

episodes.synopsis: The team takes on the case of Valerie, an attractive female executive experiencing random episodes of excruciating pain.
episodes.title: Remorse

episodes.synopsis: House and the team rush to treat an ailing college football star in time for the patient to compete in NFL tryouts.
episodes.title: Moving the Chains

episodes.synopsis: Dr. Lisa Cuddy wrestles with a myriad of hospital issues and staff disputes that test her perseverance and skills, all while juggling personal issues.
episodes.title: 5 to 9

episodes.synopsis: The team treats a famous blogger, but finds her difficult to treat when she insists on discussing all procedures and doctors on her blog.
episodes.title: Private Lives

episodes.synopsis: House tries to diagnose a high school senior suffering from blackouts and hallucinations, and is forced to take a controversial approach.
episodes.title: Black Hole

episodes.synopsis: When the hospital is sent into lockdown mode due to a missing infant, all of the doctors must remain where they are.
episodes.title: Lockdown

episodes.synopsis: The diagnostics team takes on the case of a man roleplaying as a knight who collapses at the end of a duel during the Renaissance Fair.
episodes.title: Knight Fall

episodes.synopsis: A woman in an open marriage suddenly becomes ill during a date with her boyfriend; House tests Wilson and Sam's relationship.
episodes.title: Open and Shut

episodes.synopsis: The team takes on the case of an ailing groom-to-be who harbors undisclosed secrets from a previous relationship.
episodes.title: The Choice

episodes.synopsis: House tells Dr. Nolan about the case of a woman suffering from both amnesia and another mystery condition. But something else is troubling House.
episodes.title: Baggage

episodes.synopsis: After a crane collapse buries a woman in rubble, House must split his time between staying with her and diagnosing the crane operator who passed out.
episodes.title: Help Me

episodes.synopsis: House and Cuddy take the day off to talk about their relationship, while the team tries to cure the lone neurosurgeon on staff, who needs to operate.
episodes.title: Now What?

episodes.synopsis: The team treats a teen skateboarder who collapsed during a competition, and her family must make an impossible decision.
episodes.title: Selfish

episodes.synopsis: House and his team race against time to help an author who suffered a seizure while attempting to kill herself.
episodes.title: Unwritten

episodes.synopsis: House and the team treat a woman suffering from severe vomiting and heart problems, but they discover that she's not who she says she is.
episodes.title: Massage Therapy

episodes.synopsis: When a newborn experiences breathing problems, the team must look at her mother's medical history for clues.
episodes.title: Unplanned Parenthood

episodes.synopsis: Brilliant medical student Martha M. Masters joins the team at Cuddy's insistence. Her first case is treating a campaign manager with liver failure.
episodes.title: Office Politics

episodes.synopsis: A teenage girl comes to the hospital displaying smallpox symptoms, which the team dismisses as impossible -- until her stepfather gets sick as well.
episodes.title: A Pox on Our House

episodes.synopsis: House's patient gets sick after crucifying himself as part of a bargain with God to keep his daughter cancer-free.
episodes.title: Small Sacrifices

episodes.synopsis: When a bassist passes out after saving a woman in a subway station, the team must treat him amidst his newfound celebrity.
episodes.title: Larger than Life

episodes.synopsis: A drill sergeant at a camp for troubled kids collapses with severe back pain, and one of his recruits falls ill with the same symptoms.
episodes.title: Carrot or Stick

episodes.synopsis: Cuddy's mother is rushed to the hospital with heart problems, but she refuses treatment by House.
episodes.title: Family Practice

episodes.synopsis: A woman comes to the hospital with temporary paralysis, but it's her perfect memory that compels House to take the case.
episodes.title: You Must Remember This

episodes.synopsis: House attends a career day at an elementary school. Most of the class becomes fascinated with the case of a man who literally coughed up a lung.
episodes.title: Two Stories

episodes.synopsis: A real estate higher-up is admitted to the hospital with a severe rash, and it soon becomes clear that he's hiding something from his wife.
episodes.title: Recession Proof

episodes.synopsis: When Cuddy is admitted to the hospital, House is confronted with the fact that he is not the supportive boyfriend Cuddy needs him to be.
episodes.title: Bombshells

episodes.synopsis: Newly single and back on Vicodin, House begins to worry that nothing -- not even medical puzzles -- can excite him anymore.
episodes.title: Out of the Chute

episodes.synopsis: A homeless man is taken to the hospital after suffering a burn, but he steadfastly refuses to give any information about his real identity.
episodes.title: Fall from Grace

episodes.synopsis: House discovers that Thirteen has been in prison for the past six months and attempts to discover what crime she was guilty of.
episodes.title: The Dig

episodes.synopsis: Masters prepares to graduate. Her final case is that of a teenage girl aiming to become the youngest sailor to circumnavigate the globe.
episodes.title: Last Temptation

episodes.synopsis: The team takes on the case of a lottery winner suffering from paralysis and cancer. Is his new millionaire lifestyle making him sick?
episodes.title: Changes

episodes.synopsis: After losing a bet over a boxing match, House is convinced that the fighter he bet on has an underlying medical condition that cost him the fight.
episodes.title: The Fix

episodes.synopsis: When House discovers that the experimental drug he has been using causes fatal tumors, he decides to attempt to excise them himself.
episodes.title: After Hours

episodes.synopsis: The team treats a seriously ill performance artist who deliberately induced additional symptoms in herself.
episodes.title: Moving On

episodes.synopsis: With only five days left to serve for driving his car into Cuddy's house, a jailed House finds himself scrambling to pay a gang leader an "exit tax."
episodes.title: Twenty Vicodin

episodes.synopsis: House is released from prison, only to find things have changed: He's lost his team and half his office, and Wilson is giving him the cold shoulder.
episodes.title: Transplant

episodes.synopsis: When a man collapses after making a $1 million charitable contribution, House and Park suspect his altruism may be a sign of a neurological disorder.
episodes.title: Charity Case

episodes.synopsis: When a CEO falls ill days before a major business decision, House sees it as a perfect opportunity to fund the department through a little blackmail.
episodes.title: Risky Business

episodes.synopsis: The team takes the case of a man with heart problems, who confesses all of his sins to clear his conscience, compromising his prospects for recovery.
episodes.title: The Confession

episodes.synopsis: When a partially paralyzed teenage boy is admitted to Princeton Plainsboro, the team discovers a family secret that may threaten his treatment.
episodes.title: Parents

episodes.synopsis: The team takes the case of an anaphylactic teen whose condition worsens. Meanwhile, House tries to unravel the mystery of a 4-year-old's death.
episodes.title: Dead & Buried

episodes.synopsis: After a prosecutor suffers an apparent heart attack, the team reconsiders their original diagnosis when they find a huge cache of weapons in his home.
episodes.title: Perils of Paranoia

episodes.synopsis: House and the team treat an Alzheimer's patient who's vomiting and showing aggression. Meanwhile, Foreman and House cross swords.
episodes.title: Better Half

episodes.synopsis: House and Adams argue over whether to call social services when an underage runaway needs surgery requiring adult consent.
episodes.title: Runaways

episodes.synopsis: House and his team face a disciplinary hearing after a patient in a steroid-induced psychosis becomes violent and stabs Chase.
episodes.title: Nobody's Fault

episodes.synopsis: During the course of treating a nun on the verge of taking her final vows, Chase's objectivity is compromised when he develops feelings for her.
episodes.title: Chase

episodes.synopsis: After a marriage counselor collapses during a speaking engagement, the team discovers that his low testosterone levels are the cause.
episodes.title: Man of the House

episodes.synopsis: When a blind patient suffering from auditory hallucinations begins coughing up blood, his treatment could leave him further disabled.
episodes.title: Love Is Blind

episodes.synopsis: Admitted to the hospital after collapsing, a soldier accused of treason refuses treatment until the military provides information about his father.
episodes.title: Blowing the Whistle

episodes.synopsis: House and the team take on the case of a minor-league hockey player who began coughing up blood after a fight on the ice.
episodes.title: Gut Check

episodes.synopsis: The team suspects a neurological component when they meet a patient's "girlfriend" -- a lifelike sex doll he's fallen in love with.
episodes.title: We Need the Eggs

episodes.synopsis: When nightmares about being choked lead to breathing problems, a boy is admitted to the hospital. Meanwhile, House learns that Wilson has cancer.
episodes.title: Body & Soul

episodes.synopsis: The team works with the mother of a 6-year-old suffering from a rare genetic disorder. Meanwhile, Wilson chooses a radical treatment for his cancer.
episodes.title: The C-Word

episodes.synopsis: The team must treat the hospital's injured coroner, who will only entrust his medical care to House -- but he's unreachable.
episodes.title: Post Mortem

episodes.synopsis: The team must decide which symptoms are psychological as they treat a college student suffering nosebleeds, who also hears his dead brother's voice.
episodes.title: Holding On

episodes.synopsis: In the emotional series finale, House is forced to confront his personal demons as he decides whether his life is worth living.
episodes.title: Everybody Dies
